Malaysian King Hopes for Closer Relations with DPRK 
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Malaysia hopes that the relations between Malaysia and the DPRK would become closer through visits and contacts in the future, too. Malaysian King Tuanku Syed Sirajuddin Ibni Al�|Marhum Tuanku Syed Putra Jamalullail said this when meeting the DPRK ambassador to his country who paid a farewell call on him on July 20.
 The relations between the two countries have developed on good terms, he noted, adding that the visits and contacts of delegations in recent years have contributed to boosting the bilateral relations.

articles.content:
Moves for Expansion of U.S. Military Base Assailed
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- The All-People Measure Committee for Checking the Expansion of the U.S. Military Base in Phyongthaek reportedly held the fourth all-people meeting for checking the expansion and made public a resolution on July 22.
 Recalling that on July 20 the south Korean "government" charged inhabitants of Phyongthaek and the all-people measure committee poisoned the atmosphere of talks over the issue of the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek, the resolution said that its outcries shifting the responsibility for the rupture of the talks onto the inhabitants and the measure committee remind one of a thief crying "Stop the thief!" and are nothing but a cunning attempt to invent a subterfuge for the eviction of the inhabitants.    
 It bitterly denounced the "government's" unilateral and violent moves for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek and urged it to immediately stop the moves and renegotiate the expansion plan with the U.S. as demanded by the people.

Floral Basket and Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Il
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a floral basket and congratulatory letter by the military attaches' corps here on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War. 
 They were handed to an official concerned by Igor Pablov, military attache of the Russian embassy, on behalf of the corps on Wednesday.

articles.title: Greetings to Polish PM
articles.content:
Kim Il Chol Calls for Bolstering War Deterrent for Self-Defence
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- It is a stark reality in the DPRK that it can survive without sweets but not without bullets, said Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, in a report made at a national meeting held to mark the 53rd anniversary of the victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War. He called for giving priority to the development of national defence industry as required by the Workers' Party of Korea's line of economic construction in the Songun era and thus further bolstering the nation's war deterrent for self-defence.
  He stated that the nation's capacity for self-defence provides a sure guarantee for defending the sovereignty of the country and the nation and defending peace, declaring that it is the consistent principled stand of the WPK and the state of the DPRK to bolster the army and give priority to national defence.

Greetings to Polish PM
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Pak Pong Ju sent a message of greetings to Jaroslaw Kaczynski on his appointment as prime minister of Poland.
 In the belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger in mutual interests, the message wished him great success in his responsible work for prosperity of the country and welfare of the people.

Greetings to Liberian President
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Liberian President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf on the independence day of the country.
 Kim in the message sincerely wished the president and people of Liberia great success in their work for the peace, stability and reconstruction of the country.

articles.content:
Greetings to Maldivian President
   Pyongyang, July 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Maldivian President Maumoon Abdul Gayoom on the independence day of the country.
 Expressing the belief that the relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work and the Maldivian people progress and prosperity.
